snippet: A new video that seems to show Syrian rebels summarily executing a group of captured soldiers or militiamen could, if verified, represent evidence of a war crime, the United Nations said on Friday.
abstract: United Nations says video from Syria circulating on Internet appears to show antigovernment fighters summarily executing a group of captive soldiers or militiamen, and, if verified, could represent evidence of a war crime; video also illustrates what rights activists call distressing trend of atrocities committed by both sides in 20-month-old conflict.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Neil MacFarquhar, Hwaida Saad and Hania Mourtada from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: A new video that seems to show Syrian rebels summarily executing a group of captured soldiers or militiamen could, if verified, represent evidence of a war crime, the United Nations said on Friday.

headline.seo: U.N. Says Syria Execution Video Shows Apparent War Crime
headline.main: U.N. Says Execution Video From Syria Shows Apparent War Crime
headline.print_headline: U.N. Says Execution Video From Syria Shows Apparent War Crime
